messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, a gentleman was just talking to you about someone that's broken into my house and he can't find his brother.
Someone broke into your house and now you can't find his brother?
Yes, this is...
Okay, do you want to do a missing person report or...?
I don't know. It's his brother. I don't know who this gentleman is. I heard the door banging and next thing I know he's in my house. Please hurry.
So the person is in your house. Do you know them?
No, I don't know them.
So you just heard someone, your neighbor, it's your neighbor, right?
No, I've never seen them. There was a U-Haul truck.
So you let him inside your house, and he requested that you call the police?
He called on my house phone, supposedly, saying that someone told him to meet him here with money for his brother.
And where are you now?
Outside.
And he's in the U-Haul truck?
Yes, he's very agitated, says he's worried about his brother.
Is he a white male or black male?
He's black with a white female.
And what is your name?
Um, sorry, my name is...
So he just came in the house to use the phone. Did he tell you anything else?
Um, someone has broken into my house. The door is broken.
So somebody broke into your house as well?
Yes, I was asleep in the bedroom and heard a loud banging, and the next thing I know, he was in my house.
So the subject broke into your house?
Yes, he says he was with someone else, so please hurry.
And you're still outside?
Yes.
Alright, give me one second, okay? Hold on, okay?
Sorry.
Hello?
Ma'am?
They've left. I knew it was him that broke into my house. They've left.
Okay, did you see what he had on?
Yes, a yellow shirt and black and green shorts.
Did he take anything?
I don't know. I'm sorry. He's gone. I knew it was him that broke in. They had a U-Haul. I think they were stealing from my house. I don't know what he's done with my phone.
You don't see your phone?
No, I don't know if he really called you or not. That's why I got my cell phone and called. He wanted my cell phone.
Did you see which way they went?
We live on a little cul-de-sac at the end. Please hurry.
Yes, ma'am. Officers are en route. Stay on the phone with me, okay?
I'm sorry about this. I'm disabled.
It's going to be all right. And you don't see your phone?
No.
And you said they were in the U-Haul truck, correct?
Yes. The female is white.
The female is white?
Yes.
And this just happened a few minutes ago?
Yes, just a few minutes ago.
It's going to be all right, ma'am. Did he say he wasn't going to hurt you?
Yes, but he didn't know where his brother was. Someone told him to bring $100 to get his brother and he didn't want to get in any trouble.
Okay, did he appear to be a young male or older male?
Young male.
Were you upstairs or in your room?
I was in my bedroom with the door locked. I had gone back to sleep.
So you were in your room and then he came in and entered your room, correct?
I kept hearing banging in the house. I knew my husband wasn't home. Next thing I know, he was in my house, asking for his brother.
Okay, and he said he didn't want to get in trouble?
No, I don't know if he's got a record or something, but when I saw the U-Haul, I knew their intentions, especially since I broke down two doors.
It's going to be all right, ma'am. Just hold on.
He asked me for cash, and I gave him about $5. He said he was calling the police, but I don't know if he really called you, so I called with my cell phone.
We have K-9 units en route.
I'm sorry about this. I don't know why they would have come here.
They probably thought no one was home.
I didn't hear the banging for a while.
Is it like a one-way-in, one-way-out neighborhood?
Yes, you turn in and can't get out unless you go back the same way.
Okay, is it a big U-Haul truck?
It's a decent size, probably their smallest big truck. She was blonde and tubby, he was thin.
So he was thin with a yellow shirt and black hair?
Yes, and she was white with short blonde hair.
It's going to be all right, ma'am.
I don't know if I should stay here with my dog or go somewhere else.
Just don't touch anything. The police will handle it.
I'm so scared.
It's going to be all right. Can you hold on for two seconds?
Communications staff. Hey Joy, do we have an ETA for the units?
I'm not sure, let me check.
Ma'am, do you need to contact your husband?
He's in Amsterdam.
Do you have a neighbor or anyone you can call?
I was going to call my dad. I was trying to see if my neighbor was home. He did take something out of my house, besides the phones, I'm not sure what else.
The police are arriving. Do you see them?
Yes, I see them.
Okay, ma'am. I'm going to let you go as soon as I hear the officer.
Thank you so much for staying on the line.
No problem, ma'am. All right, take care.
Bye-bye.
